real: According to WHO, there is no evidence that drinking hot water kills coronavirus. Maintaining hygiene and vaccination are key.
COVID-19 is spread through respiratory droplets, not mobile networks, says WHO.
Garlic is healthy but there's no evidence it can cure COVID-19, according to WHO.
WHO confirms that COVID-19 vaccines do not affect fertility in men or women.

fake: Only old people need to worry about COVID-19.
real: WHO states that people of all ages can get infected and severely affected by COVID-19.

fake: Taking antibiotics helps prevent or treat COVID-19.
real: WHO confirms antibiotics do not work against viruses, only bacteria. They should not be used for COVID-19 prevention or treatment.

fake: COVID-19 is just like the flu.
real: COVID-19 spreads more easily, causes more severe illness in some people, and has higher mortality compared to flu, says WHO.
WHO states that wearing a mask for prolonged periods does not cause CO2 intoxication or oxygen deficiency.

fake: Home remedies like ginger and turmeric can cure COVID-19.
real: While they may boost immunity, WHO emphasizes that they cannot cure or prevent COVID-19.
There is no microchip in any of the COVID-19 vaccines. WHO assures all approved vaccines are safe and transparent in ingredients.
